media.title: Maps Seminar Excursion - The Tilted Tree

projects.title: A Critical Mapping of Mount Scopus
projects.subtitle: Research Seminar  “MAPS: Representations of Place in the Arts”u
projects.synopsis:
Documentation of excursions and projects on the Mount Scopus campus of the Hebrew University of Jerusalem, as part of the research seminar “MAPS: Representations of Place in the Arts”. 

The graduate seminar, conducted in the School of Arts at the Hebrew University in spring 2014, was a critical study of the relationships between maps and arts. The seminar was designed to investigate the uses and displays of maps and mapping in the contemporary arts, with an emphasis on the Israeli and Jewish scenes. It examined artistic strategies, stressing new resources open to artists via digital technologies and cyber art, confronting the naturalized relations between geographical accounts and systems of representations: language, history, perspective, sound and transparency. 

The loci of the seminar, the campus of Mount Scopus, served as a laboratory to explore the relevant theoretical and practical concepts. The seminar included a series of excursions in different places on the campus conducted by guest lecturers. These excursions offered a critical view of different aspects of the campus: the architecture, the geo-political situation, land-design issues and collaborative map-making.

Webpage of seminar in Da'at Hamakom
